Class ShapeRegistry

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--ShapeRegistry
public class ShapeRegistry
extends java.lang.Object

This is a registry class for shape classes.

Method Summary
 void clearRegistry()
          Clears the sole ShapeRegistry instance and all of its registered objects.
 Shape get(java.lang.String name)
          Returns a clone Shape using the key name, if one is found.
static ShapeRegistry instance()
          Allows only one reference of the ShapeRegistry class to be creating by calling a private constructor.
 void register(Shape shape)
          Registers a Shape with the registry.
 void register(java.lang.String name, Shape shape)
          Registers a key and a corresponding Shape with the registry.
 void showKeys()
          Prints all of the keys in this registry to the console.
 void unregister(java.lang.String name)
          Removes a Shape based on a key string.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

public Shape get(java.lang.String name)
Returns a clone Shape using the key name, if one is found.

showKeys

public void showKeys()
Prints all of the keys in this registry to the console.

instance

public static ShapeRegistry instance()
Allows only one reference of the ShapeRegistry class to be creating by calling a private constructor.
Returns:

register

public void register(java.lang.String name,
                     Shape shape)
Registers a key and a corresponding Shape with the registry.
Parameters:
name - the key to register
shape - a corresponding Shape

register

public void register(Shape shape)
Registers a Shape with the registry. The Shape's class name is automatically used as the corresponing key.
Parameters:
the - Shape to register

unregister

public void unregister(java.lang.String name)
Removes a Shape based on a key string.
Parameters:
name - the key string

clearRegistry

public void clearRegistry()
Clears the sole ShapeRegistry instance and all of its registered objects.
